channel.title: Object Oriented on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in Object Oriented on Memo Tut

item.title: What is functional programming and object-oriented? Python edition
Embed matplotlib graph in Tkinter
item.description: #1.First of all Recently, there were the following hurdles regarding programming. (1) I want to create a GUI program in Python. → You can use Tkinter (2) I want to display some calculation results on a graph. → You can use matplotlib (3) I want to embed the graph written in matplotlib in (2) into Tkinter in (1). → NG I tried to get over it by tampering with the example code, but it didn’t work.

item.title: Object-oriented learning with python
item.description: This is the [ITRC Advent Calendar 2019](https://adventar.org/calendars/4759) 18th day article. Last article next time : ?? Background Alright! Rust’s program! Hmm? Why am I getting an error here? Hmm? What do you mean? If you fix it here! fixed? No, I got more errors! ? The bad date has changed. .. Hmm? Same as last week..? I don’t know what I mean ~~~? ? ? ? ? ? It is Hello!

item.title: I looked back on the Python class again
item.description: This article is the 9th day article of [Python Part 3 Advent Calendar 2019 ](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/python3). In this article, I'll take a look back at the basics of Python classes as a memorandum. In addition, this article refers to some of the following books. Minna no Python 4th Edition Encapsulation pattern 1 This function is used when you do not want to refer to the variables in the class from the outside or update them.

item.title: [Python] Object-oriented programming learned with Pokemon
item.description: Pokemon Sword Shield has recently been released and is very popular. So, taking advantage of this popularity of Pokemon, I will explain object-oriented programming using Pokemon. What is object-oriented programming? “Object” is a direct translation of an object. In other words, we try to program as we make things. Things should have features or parts and movements. The kind of thing is called “class”, each thing is called “instance”, and the behavior of thing is called “method”.
